data.text:
2. Being John Malkovich A puppeteer discovers a portal that leads literally into the head of the movie star, John Malkovich. IMDB rating: 7.8/10 Rotten Tomatoes rating: 93% Fresh https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2UuRFr0GnH M

3. Cast John Malkovich Known for films such as Eragon, Transformers: Dark of the Moon, Warm Bodies, RED, and he was Lennie in Of Mice and Men. Last year he came across a man who was bleeding profusely from his neck and applied First Aid until the ambulance arrived. What a hero.

4. Cast Known for films such as 2012, 1408, High Fidelity, and many romantic comedies! He is rumoured to be in the next Hunger Games film. I have an old-man crush on him  John Cusack

5. Cast Cameron Diaz Known for films such as Charlie’s Angels, There’s Something About Mary, Shrek, and many others where she does not play the brightest character! Recently announced she will make a sequel to Bad Teacher. I have never seen the first one as it seems insulting to the teaching profession.

6. Cast Catherine Keener Known for films such as The 40 Year Old Virgin, Captain Phillips, Into the Wild, and many independent films. Has worked on many projects with Spike Jonze in her career.

7. Awards Won: BAFTA Film Award for Best Screenplay Original and many other Critics’ Choice Awards and Film Festivals Nominated: Oscar for Best Actress in a Supporting Role, Best Director and Best Writing Golden Globe for Best Motion Picture, Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role in a Motion Picture X2, and Best Screenplay Motion Picture

8. Writer Charles Stuart "Charlie" Kaufman (born November 19, 1958) is an American screenwriter, producer, director, and lyricist.

9. Charlie Kaufman - Filmography Year Title Credit 1999 Being John Malkovich Writer and executive producer 2001 Human Nature Writer and producer 2002 Adaptation Writer and executive producer 2002 Confessions of a Dangerous Mind Writer 2004 Eternal Sunshine of a Spotless Mind Writer and executive producer 2008 Synecdoche, New York Writer, director and producer 2011 Kung Fu Panda 2 Script reviser Plus writing credits for a range of television shows including Ned and Stacey

10. Reputation Kaufman is praised for being highly original and imaginative. • Being John Malkovich stars John Malkovich as a fictional version of himself • Human Nature is mostly told by flashbacks • Adaptation tells the story of Kaufman himself, trying to write the film itself and to understand the book from which it is adapted with the help of his twin brother fictional twin brother • Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind mainly takes place in the mind of the main character while his memory is erased • Synecdoche, New York focuses on a theatre director who blurs the line between reality and his production

11. Director Spike Jonze (born Adam Spiegel; October 22, 1969) is an American director, producer, screenwriter and actor, whose work includes music videos, commercials, film and television.

12. Spike Jonze - Filmography Year Title Credit 1997 Free Tibet Cinematographer 1999 Being John Malkovich Director 2000 Jackass (TV) Creator and executive producer 2001 Human Nature Producer 2002 Adaptation Director 2002 Jackass: The Movie Producer and actor 2006 Jackass: Number Two Producer and actor 2006 The Fall Producer and actor 2008 Synecdoche, New York Producer 2008 Heavy Metal in Baghdad Producer

13. Year Title Credit 2009 Where the Wild Things Are Director and co-writer 2009 The 1 Second Film Producer and actor 2009 Jackass 3D Producer and actor 2010 Higglety Pigglety Pop! Or There Must Be More to Life Producer and actor 2013 Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa Producer and writer 2013 Her Director and writer

14. Reputation Jonze is renowned for the many music videos he has directed. Artists he has worked with include Sonic Youth, R.E.M., Bjork, Daft Punk, Puff Daddy, The Notorious B.I.G., Jay-Z, Arcade Fire and many more. • Buddy Holly by Weezer https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kemivUKb4f4 • Sabotage by Beastie Boys https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z5rRZdiu1UE • Praise You by Fat Boy Slim https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ruAi4VBoBSM

15. Why John Malkovich? I don't know... I thought it was funny. It's hard to explain, but I thought it was funny, but not jokey. Because [John Malkovich] is a serious actor, he is a great actor, but there is something odd about him and there is something behind his eyes that you can't see. And I thought that was a good person for this. And then I think his name is perfect for the title... when we trying to get the movie made... we didn't know if John was going to do it and Spike [Jonze] and I sort of tried to make a list of other possibilities and there are lots of good actors but nobody's name sounded good in the title... so... it was important for that reason. - Kaufman in an interview with Charlie Rose

16. Was John Malkovich keen? Not to begin with. Apparently Malkovich liked the script but did not think he would suit the lead role and offered to produce the film with a different title actor. Kaufman refused and continued to approach Malkovich about is periodically. After many years Malkovich was eventually worn down and agreed to star. Jonze revealed in a September 2013 interview that this was Malkovich's attitude after filming commenced: Either the movie's a bomb and it's got not only my name above the title but my name in the title, so I'm fucked that way; or it does well and I'm just forever associated with this character.
